column1: #Credit to Keizer Harm for a good amount of this
# After much deliberation I settled on the present participle of yupaychay, "to worship", in the Cuzco dialect. Trust, me finding a proper name for the Inca religion took hours. - KH

column2: The Inca religion of Yupaychaspa is a polytheistic faith system with the sun god Inti at the head.
The Inca religion of Yupaychaspa is a polytheistic faith system with the sun god Inti at the head.
The Inca Invasion will occur at the very earliest in the 13th century.
The Inca Invasion will occur at a random date, though at the earliest 50 years after that game is started.
The Inca Invasion will occur at a random date, though at the earliest at the year 1000, and 50 years after the game has started.
The Inca Invasion will not occur.
All shall bow before the might of my blessed realm, and none shall question my rule!
Some Papuan notables join your court

A wealthy Chinese merchant by the name of Ma He recently left Guangzhou with a large fleet of ships, sailing in the direction of the Ma-i-an Archipelago on what should have been a fairly ordinary voyage. However, rumor has it that he has yet to arrive in the archipelago, and where the merchant's fleet has ended up is unclear.\n\nA few sailors aboard other ships that recently have returned from the archipelago have claimed that they witnessed a large number of ship heading further east, directly towards a brewing storm, though many suspect that they simply are telling tall tales in the hopes of getting free drinks at whichever tavern they are visiting.

Word has reached my court that a small ship with a half-starved crew made landfall in the easternmost reaches of Java recently. The sailors aboard claim to have been part of Ma He's fleet, and that they are all that remain.\n\nAccording to their rather fanciful tale, the fleet crossed the Eastern Ocean and arrived off the coast of a previously unknown continent. There, the fleet supposedly was captured by the forces of the "Lord of the Dawn", the ruler of a vast realm the sailors call the "Burning Empire". If the sailors are to be believed, they are all that remain from a much larger group that made a daring escape, and many ships had to be left behind.

The great archipelago east of Java is known to be home to many savage tribes that have little to offer to the civilized peoples of the world, and thus it is an area that few pay attention to and fewer care to visit.\n\nHowever, unusual rumors have recently started to spread from the achipelago, telling of a great tribe of warriors in enormous ships that supposedly have started attacking the people there, with great success. Where these invaders came from is somewhat unclear, though some whisper that they came across the Eastern Ocean.

Today a small ship arrived from the eastern archipelago, bringing with it an emissary claiming to have been charged with negotiate on behalf of a group of refugees due to arrive before long. Apparently, they wish to settle in [papuan_refugee_province.GetName] as their homeland supposedly was conquered by the strangers from the east.
I suppose I can allow it...
There is no place for you here!

We will have to take [papuan_refugee_province.GetName] by force, then! the emissary declares, turning and taking his leave.\n\nMy courtiers are rather too amused by this bold claim to try to stop the man, and he returns to his ship and sets sail.

A small band of warriors from the eastern archipelago arrived on the shores of [papuan_refugee_province.GetName] today, wasting no time before disembarking and launching an attack on the nearest settlement. Clearly, they could not accept their emissary's failure to secure the land peacefully.

Today a small ship bearing what passes for notables from among the people living in the eastern archipelago arrived at my court. They humbly request permission to stay, claiming that they have nowhere else to go as their homeland has been lost to the vast armies of the "Takers of Daughers".
You can stay in my court!

Several large ships have been making landfall in Japan and in various islands further south, carrying with them official-looking strangers escorted by large numbers of warriors that have come ashore demanding to speak to the local authorities.\n\nI granted an audience to one such group, and their leader formally requested permission to settle in [province_being_bought.GetName] in the future along with some of his countrymen, offering a substantial payment of silver in return. When asked how many settlers they would be bringing, the man claimed that I hardly need to concern myself with such details, repeating the offer of silver for land.
I can set aside some land for you...
My land is not for sale!

The strange ships have departed, sailing south and east. The envoys did not look pleased when they departed, and some people that were nearby as the strangers boarded their ships claim to have heard one of the strangers say something about the region having to be left to the "Golden Hosts" of the "Lord of the Dawn", whatever that is supposed to mean.
I have a bad feeling about this...

The strange ships have departed, sailing south and east. The envoys looked rather pleased when they departed, and some people that were nearby claim to have heard one of the strangers say something about there being no need for the "Golden Hosts" of the "Lord of the Dawn" to intervene in the region, whatever that is supposed to mean.
What a strange thing to say...
Hundreds of menacing ships have arrived off the shores of [Root.GetName], spilling out numberless hordes of fierce warriors in strange garb. Their ululating battle cries can be heard for miles!
Throw them back into the sea!

A mighty fleet consisting of hundreds of warships have arrived off the shores of [From.GetName], bringing one of the seemingly inexhaustable armies of the Sapa Inca with it, which made landfall shortly after dawn while letting out ululating battle cries.\n\nThough the invaders have proven unwilling to negotiate at this point, some of the refugees fleeing before their advance claim that they have proclaimed that they have been tasked with securing the entirety of what they have termed the "Sunset Isles" for their ruler, and unless they are stopped it is likely that their advance will continue even further.
Hundreds of menacing ships have arrived off the shores of [Root.GetName], spilling out numberless hordes of fierce warriors in strange garb. Their ululating battle cries can be heard for miles!
Throw them back into the sea!

A mighty fleet consisting of hundreds of warships have arrived off the shores of [From.GetName], bringing one of the seemingly inexhaustable armies of the Sapa Inca with it, along with priests and priestesses sworn to their heathen god Inti, whose followers supposedly have been victorious in every war fought in his name.\n\nMany of those who have fled before the invaders claim that their priestesses steal away the daughters of those that submit, supposedly to either be wedded off to foreign lords or sacrificed to the merciless god of the sun for the benefit of the whole empire.
Hundreds of menacing ships have arrived off the shores of [Root.GetName], spilling out numberless hordes of fierce warriors in strange garb. Their ululating battle cries can be heard for miles!
Throw them back into the sea!

A mighty fleet consisting of hundreds of warships have arrived off the shores of [From.GetName], bringing one of the seemingly inexhaustable armies of the Sapa Inca with it. These warriors have been heard letting out ululating cries and are dressed in strange armor made of painted wood and chequered cloth.\n\nThough the battle still rages, some of those fleeing from the invaders claim that they demand that all adopt their strange customs and their heathen religion, and that the people of the towns that refuse are put to death so that the area can be repopulated with Quechua settlers...

Knowing of the mightly armies and immense fleets brought to bear by the Incan invaders further south, the rulers of various islands to the north of the Ma-i-an Archipelago have been doing what they can to prepare themselves for a similar onslaught, but it has become clear that they will face a different threat.\n\nInstead of a single mighty host carried by one grand armada, several smaller armies of Inca warriors have made landfall, each of them seemingly operating independently. Those that have managed to flee before the onslaight claim that the invaders have come to claim what they previously purchased.
Hundreds of menacing ships have arrived off the shores of [Root.GetName], spilling out numberless hordes of fierce warriors in strange garb. Their ululating battle cries can be heard for miles!
Throw them back into the sea!

A mighty fleet consisting of hundreds of warships have arrived off the shores of [From.GetName], bringing one of the seemingly inexhaustable armies of the Sapa Inca with it, and disproving the claims made by those those that thought that the invaders would not seek to make landfall so far north.\n\nThere is a lot of confusion at the moment, but according to some of the refugees fleeing before the invaders they bring priests and common craftsmen on their ships in addition to their strangely armed and armored warriors, which indicates that the plan is to colonize the region and not just to launch a great raid.

The great Inca warhost that crossed the ocean in their mad bid to conquer All Under Heaven has been thrown back into the sea. Their colonies have been lost and their armies vanquished. The pitiful remnants of their invasion force has set sail back towards their homeland of Kay Pacha to lick their wounds and inform the Sapa Inca of their defeat.\n\nThere may come a time when their own shores are visited by fleets from the Old World, and when that happens the debt they have incurred with their former victims will no doubt be collected in full... with interest.
A reckoning will not be postponed indefinitely!

The Inca invaders have come into contact with many things that were unfamiliar to them prior to their arrival since they arrived in Asia, and though some of the things they have become fascinated with would be rather mundane as far as the locals would be concerned a few of the things the invaders have taken a liking to are not qutie as mundane.\n\nOne such thing is silk, which they have seen fit to ship back vast quantities of to their homeland so that the tailors of Cuzco can make good use of it when creating clothes for the Sapa Inca and those in his favor. The resulting clothing is reportedly strange, but beautiful.
At least the savage isn't naked...

Though they were hesitant to try it at first, the Inca invaders have acquired a taste for tea since their arrival in Asia, and rumor has it vast tea plantations are being constructed back in their distant homeland to ensure that it always will be available for the children of Inti.\n\nIt is said that the Sapa Inca [Root.GetHerselfHimself] likes to hold elaborate tea ceremonies unlike any seen before when hosting [Root.GetHerHis] favorite courtiers, and that [Root.GetHerHis] most trusted generals often drink copious amounts of tea whenever they meet to discuss the process of forging a lasting empire where the sun never sets.
The Fall of the Great Jungle

Thanks to the wars they have waged in what they have named the "Sunset Archipelago", the Inca armies have become quite accustomed to jungles. There is, as usual, precious little information from overseas, but from what can be pieced together it seems the Inca have finally pacified their stubborn rivals in the eastern jungle.\n\nThe Tupi Alliance and the Muisca Confedertion have already been incorporated into their growing empire, and Cuzco armies are now marching towards the last hold-outs of the Free Lokono City-States on the far coast. It may only be a matter of time before the entire continent is ruled from the great imperial city of Cuzco.
The same must never happen here!

The Inca have been fascinated with fireworks ever since the first time they encountered them, and their interest in them has often bordered on an obseession. Reportedly, several of their armies have had standing orders to secure as many fireworks as possible during their campaigns.\n\nRumor has it the invaders have been shipping the captured fireworks back to their homeland on a frequent basis, and that they no longer simply use them to entertain the Sapa Inca and the people of Cuzco. Just what they are being used for is unclear, though some truly outlandish tales claim that they will be used to make Inti's enemies feel his fury.
The power of the sun... in the palm of my hand!

column3: Rumors have reached Asia of a titanic struggle taking place across the Great Sea in the homeland of the Inca. The Inca themselves rarely discuss it with outsiders, but it appears they have been locked in a deadly war for some time with the Mexica, a great empire from the jungles far to the north of Cuzco. They are ruled by the Huehuetlatoani, who has allegedly sacrificed untold millions of people to his terrible blood gods.\n\nIf the stories are to be believed, the warriors of the Mexica managed to inflict a crushing defeat on the Sapa Inca's forces through the use of mounted warriors, and the armies of Inti were forced to withdraw further south.

column2: These "Blood-Gods" apparently got plenty of blood...

The Inca armies have secured control over the massive temple of Borobudur, and reports are claiming that the priests of Inti already are making preliminary plans to consecrate it in his name, having declared it one of the holiest sites in the region they have named the "Sunset Archipelago".

The armies of the Sapa Inca now control the entirety of Java, from the Sunda Strait to the Bali Strait, as well as various smaller islands further east. Having determined that the island easily could house a vast population, the invaders have requested that additional settlers be diverted to the region.
We cannot allow a permanent settlement!

The coastline of the island of Borneo now belongs to the Inca Empire. Several of the jungle tribes deeper inland still resist the invaders, but word is the invaders are not overly eager to defeat them permanently, seeing the minor skirmishes in the region as an opportunity for young warriors to prove themselves.
Perhaps this will be their undoing?

The cruel Inca invaders are now fully in control of the Ma-i-an Archipelago, and rumor has it they both are fortifying the region and are constructing new settlements to house the many settlers from their homeland, while the priests of Inti supposedly stalk the land to steal away the daughters of the locals.
These brutes must be driven out!

Palembang, once the crown jewel of the Srivijayan Empire, has fallen to the Sapa Inca's hordes. Already work is being carried out to secure the invaders' hold over the city and to throw back any counterattack, and word has it that the many temples of the city are being re-consecrated in the name of Inti.

The Sapa Inca's armies have secured the entirety of Sumatra, along with several smaller islands nearby. Reports claim that they already have had to suppress several small uprisings as some of the rural communities in the region have been even less willing than most to hand over their daughters be indoctrinated by the invaders.
Another major loss to the invaders...

The Inca have now taken over the entirety of the Ryukyuan Archipelago, and express great disdain for their "Three Mountains", which they say pale in comparison to their homeland. They have begun constructing a grand harbour, where every day more and more ships arrive carrying eager warriors seeking to join the invasion.
What will it take to stop them?

Ise now belongs to the Inca Empire, bringing the grand shrine sacred to Amaterasu under their control. The Inca have expressed disdain for the great kami, claiming that she at best is fit to be a consort of Inti, and reports have it that they might be forcing young women formerly serving Amaterasu to instead pledge themselves to Inti.

From the Tsugaru Strait in the north to Tane in the south, Japan is under the Inca yoke. The invaders have found it highly offensive that an area on the western shores of the "Great Western Ocean" is called the "Land of the Rising Sun", and have decreed that the islands must be referred to as the "Land of the Setting Sun".

The Korean Peninsula now belongs to Inti, and reports from the area claim that many Quechua settlers soon will arrive in the area. Though not adverse to using poetic names for a region, the Sapa Inca's officials have seen fit to adapt the traditional name for the region and refer to it as the "Land of the Evening Calm".
May it be anything but calm!

The great city of Angkor is now in the hands of the Sapa Inca, and the great temple complex nearby has also fallen. The priests and priestesses of Inti have already begun preparations to sanctify it to their god, declaring their intention to make it into one of the holiest places outside their distant homeland.

From Arakan to Champa, the land now belongs to the Inca Empire. The officials of the Sapa Inca have ordered the locals to provide workers for extensive construction projects, and the ululating warriors from across the sea have proven quite willing to force compliance whenever someone has seen fit to put up resistance.
They cannot be allowed to remain!

The Middle Kingdom's heartland has fallen to the warriors of Inti, perhaps signifying that the Sun God has granted them the Mandate of Heaven. The invaders appear to have found many historical texts from the region highly educational, and it is said that their generals have taken a particular interest in the Art of War.

The Tibetan Plateau now belongs to the Sapa Inca and Inti. The invaders have expressed great interest in the region, finding it somewhat comparable to their homeland, and plans are being made to construct many temples to Inti on the mountains in the area, which the invaders seem to think are taller than many of those at home.

The entirety of India has fallen to the invaders from beyond te sea, who seem undeterred even in the face of war elephants. Having heard tales of how Alexander the Great turned back shortly after crossing the Indus in the other direction, the invaders have made a sacred vow to truly continue until there is no land left to conquer.
Expel the Children of the Light
I can drive the Children of the Light from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Donate 300¤ to the Children of the Light
I can donate money to the Children of the Light in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the Priesthood.

Emboldened by the recent reformation of the Yupaychaspa faith a band of zealous Yupaychaspa have come together and sworn an oath to safeguard the faithful against the machinations of those who are friends of the darkness and to bring Inti's light to the unbelievers no matter where they might be found. Though these "Children of the Light" have yet to prove themselves, it is likely that it is only a matter of time before the order is a large enough force that any who would oppose the Yupaychaspa faith cannot afford to ignore them.
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Children of the Light in its tireless defense of the faithful, even though this will forever disinherit him.

Great [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], your extremely generous donation will aid us greatly as we fight against the enemies of the faith! Upon my honor, I shall not forget this charity!

For the defense of the faith!
Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
[This.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a Child of the Light.

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Children of the Light is in need of more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. There is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.

For the defense of the faith!
Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
The Children of the Light is constructed a castle in [Root.GetName]!

Your majesty, this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The Children of the Light merely seeks to protect the Yupaychaspa faith. Can you make that same claim?

With anger and sadness,

Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
Refused to give daughter to the Acllahuasi
This woman is an Aclla, one of the Virgins of the Sun. She might one day marry an influential husband, or be offered up in sacrifice to Inti.

The war is over and lost, but the Sapa Inca is not finished with me. An Apupanaca, an emissary from the imperial city of Cuzco, has been sent to collect one of my daughters, and his eye has fallen on the young [child_to_seize.GetFirstName].

[apupanaca.GetBestName] explains that she will be taken to the Acllahuasi, a sacred convent in Cuzco, and there instructed in the Incan ways. It is a holy place, and [child_to_seize.GetFirstName] might even receive the honor of being sacrificed to Inti when she reaches adulthood. She could also be married to the Sapa Inca, or one of his vassals.

It is a great honor, and with my levies still recuperating from the defeat at the hands of [From.GetBestName] I am in no position to refuse.
Her existing betrothal will have to be broken...

An Apupanaca has come all the way from the imperial city of Cuzco, with the sorrowful message that my house has yet to provide a girl to the sacred Acllahuasi. He is here to collect [child_to_seize.GetFirstName].

[apupanaca.GetBestName] explains that she will be taken to a convent in Cuzco, and there instructed in the Yupaychaspa ways. It is a holy place, and [child_to_seize.GetFirstName] might even receive the honor of being sacrificed to Inti when she reaches adulthood. She could also be married to the Sapa Inca, or one of his vassals.

It is a great honor, and refusing to cooperate would be seen as both foolish and treasonous.
Of course you can have her!
I suppose her betrothal must be broken...
How about we forget all about this...?

The Apupanaca had left in a hurry, spouting curses upon my house and my cows. Some of those appear to have come true, as I have now been declared an outlaw in the whole Inca realm! The Sapa Inca can imprison me at will!

Tears keep streaming down [child_to_seize.GetFirstName]'s face, no matter how long I or the Apupanaca keep explaining her new status. In the end I give up and pull her in for a long hug, and a few words whispered in her ear where the emissary cannot hear them.
I will look for opportunities to retrieve [child_to_seize.GetFirstName].
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She has no great talent.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She is a natural.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She is a true prodigy - nobody can make textiles as well as she can.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was taught the secret of making the Inca maize beer.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman learned how to make delicious maize bread, for religious or nutritious purposes.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman developed a most charming singing voice.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was trained in Incan ritual and celebratory dances.

It seems [From.GetBestName] is far more set in her [From.Religion.GetName] ways than most, as she keeps refusing to learn how best to serve the Sapa Inca and Inti and claim that [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] will punish me and my "fellow heathens".
She must learn on her own...
I will talk to her about it!
If she will not serve, she will die!

Word has reached me that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has been executed by [From.GetBestName] due to her unwillingness to serve the Sapa Inca and Inti and her continued claims that the Yupaychaspa faith is a false faith worshipped by heathen savages.
The savages will pay for this!

[aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is living in distant Cuzco with the other Aclla, serving Inti and all the Yupaychaspa faithful. She is without a doubt guarded, but I believe that I might be able to avoid or deal with the guards, and thus it might be a good idea to mount a rescue attempt.
I don't really want her back...

I have arrived outside the sacred Acllahuasi. Without doubt, [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] can be found somewhere inside, but in order to reach her I need to get past the guards you I see patrolling outside. They doubtlessly have orders to keep most people out.
I will fight my way past them!
I think I will head home...

I have returned home from Cuzco, having failed to rescue [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] from the Acllahuasi. It is possible that I will find another opportunity to do so at some point in the future, but it might also not be possible to do so as the Aclla are heavily guarded.
We will have to see what the future holds...

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are taken by surprise by my attack, and many of them fall before they can even attempt to defend themselves. The rest do their best to fight back, but they are no match for a [Root.GetManWoman] like me, and before long they all have fallen before you. The way ahead is clear.

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are taken by surprise by my attack, and many of them fall before they can even attempt to defend themselves. The rest do their best to fight back, but they are no match for a [Root.GetManWoman] like me. However, the sound of the fighting has alerted the garrison, and I must withdraw.

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are taken by surprise by my attack, and a couple of them fall before they can even attempt to defend themselves. The rest do their best to fight back, and I take a minor wound, but before long they all have fallen before me. The way ahead is clear.

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are taken by surprise by my attack, and a couple of them fall before they can even attempt to defend themselves. The rest do their best to fight back, and I take a minor wound in the fighting. Furthermore, the sound of the fighting has alerted the garrison, and I must withdraw.

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are not particularly surprised by my attack, and they quickly inflict several wounds on me. Eventually I manage to cut the last of them down, but I have taken a grievous wound in the process. At least the way ahead is clear...

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are not particularly surprised by my attack, and they quickly inflict several wounds on me. Eventually I manage to cut the last of them down, but I have taken a grievous wound in the process. Furthermore, the sound of the fighting has alerted the garrison, and I must withdraw.

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are not particularly surprised by my attack, and they fight me to a stalemate easily enough. As I am considering various ways to possibly overpower them one of them sneaks up behind me and throws his arms around me, and the rest of them quickly pile on and bring me down.

I have just learned that [From.GetBestName] sought to enter the sacred Acllahuasi to steal back [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] but that the guards managed to capture [From.GetHerHim] and have dragged [From.GetHerHim] to a cell, where [From.GetSheHe] will remain until I see fit to release [From.GetHerHim].

A short time after being imprisoned [From.GetBestName] arrives outside my cell accompanied by several guards and [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName]. [From.GetBestName] declares that my sacrilege must be punished before swiftly cutting the throat of [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName].

The guards outside the Acllahuasi are not particularly surprised by my attack, and you take several wounds almost as soon as the fight begins. Though I do my best to fight on, the wounds keep adding up, and several of them are quite bad. It is not long before I am lying on the ground, my vision darkening.

I make my presence known to the commander of the guards outside the Acllahuasi and quickly suggest that it would be in his interests to let me slip past them. I know that the guards have sworn sacred vows to keep the Acllahuasi safe, and the man is a bit hesitant, but once I produce a bag of gold he agrees to not interfere.
So much for their sacred vows...

I make my presence known to the commander of the guards outside the Acllahuasi and quickly suggest that it would be in his interests to let me slip past them. Unfortunately, the man seems to be determined to keep his sacred vow to keep the Acllahuasi safe, and he tells me to leave before he has to arrest or kill me.
I will fight my way past them!

I make my presence known to the commander of the guards outside the Acllahuasi and quickly suggest that it would be in his interests to let me slip past them. Unfortunately, the man seems to be determined to keep his sacred vow to keep the Acllahuasi safe, and he orders me to surrender to face Inti's justice.
I will take you all on!

I circle around the Acllahuasi and discover what appears to be an unguarded back entrance. I spend some time investigating it to make sure that it is not a trap, before carefully moving closer and making my way inside. I do not encounter any guards inside either, and can progress with my search.

I circle around the Acllahuasi and discover what appears to be an unguarded back entrance. I spend some time investigating it to make sure that it is not a trap, and notice a guard patrol approaching my location. They do not appear to have spotted me yet, but it is only a matter of time before they do so.
I will fight my way past them!

I circle around the Acllahuasi and discover what appears to be an unguarded back entrance. I spend some time investigating it to make sure that it is not a trap, before carefully moving closer and making my way inside. Just inside the Acllahuasi I encounter a room full of guards.
I will take you all on!

As I search the Acllahuasi for [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] I hear a voice call out for the guards. Having dealt with the guards previously, none arrive, and I discover that the person that cried out for them was [aclla_rescue_attempt_snitch.GetBestName], who seems quite surprised when I find her.
You has made your last mistake!

As I search the Acllahuasi for [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] I hear a voice call out for the guards. I am able to discover that it was [aclla_rescue_attempt_snitch.GetBestName] that cried out just before a large number of guards arrive, weapons at the ready.
I will take you all on!

The guards arrive ready to fight, but they were not prepared to face a [Root.GetManWoman] as skilled as me, and I cut them down easily enough. [aclla_rescue_attempt_snitch.GetBestName] is still nearby. She seems quite surprised that I won, and now I must decide how to deal with her.
You has made your last mistake!

The guards arrive ready to fight, but though they are able to wound me in the fighting they ultimately prove unable to stop me, and I cut them all down. [aclla_rescue_attempt_snitch.GetBestName] is still nearby. She seems quite surprised that I won, and now I must decide how to deal with her.
You has made your last mistake!

The guards arrive ready to fight, and I take a grievous wound in the fighting, but in the end I prevail and manage cut them all down. [aclla_rescue_attempt_snitch.GetBestName] is still nearby. She seems quite surprised that I won, and now I must decide how to deal with her.
You has made your last mistake!

The guards arrive ready to fight, and though I fight hard there is too many of them. Eventually one of them manages to disarm me, and the others quickly pile on. They soon have me tied up, ready to be transported to a cell beneath the Acllahuasi.

The guards are ready to fight, and I take several wounds almost as soon as the fight begins. Though I do my best to fight on, the wounds keep adding up, and several of them are quite bad. It is not long before I am lying on the ground, my vision darkening.

As I search the Acllahuasi for [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] I come across [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName], a most attractive Aclla that is seemingly all by herself. As an Aclla, she is supposed to remain a virgin until she leaves the Acllahuasi, but perhaps I can convince her to forsake those vows?
I have time for a detour...

It turns out [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] is quite receptive to the idea of forsaking her vows, and the two of us spend some rather enjoyable time together. As I am getting dressed again she asks to come with me, claiming that she does not belong in the Acllahuasi.
Come with me if you want to leave!
I can't take you with me...
You are a loose end to clear up!

[From.GetBestName] has informed me that [From.GetSheHe] is unwilling to take me with [From.GetHerHim] despite the fact that [From.GetSheHe] clearly does not respect the vows of the Aclla, as evident from the fact that [From.GetSheHe] was willing to sleep with me.
It is probably for the best...

Mere moments after I inform [From.GetBestName] that I have no intention of taking her with me she calls out for the guards. Since I have dealt with them already none appear, and I now have to decide how to deal with a rather surprised, if still scorned, young woman.
You has made your last mistake!

Mere moments after I inform [From.GetBestName] that I have no intention of taking her with me she calls out for the guards. They arrive quite swiftly, weapons at the ready, and demand that I surrender to face Inti's justice after violating the sanctity of the Acllahuasi.
I will take you all on!

It turns out [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] is not receptive to the idea of forsaking her vows, though she is somewhat flattered by the attempt and tells ne that she will keep the fact that I am inside the Acllahuasi to herself instead of calling for the guards.
I think I will trust her...
She is a loose end to clear up!

It turns out [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] is not receptive to the idea of forsaking her vows, and she calls out for the guards. Since I have dealt with them already none appear, and she looks quite surprised when she realizes that things are not going as planned.
You has made your last mistake!

It turns out [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] is not receptive to the idea of forsaking her vows, and she calls out for the guards. They arrive quite swiftly, weapons at the ready, and demand that I surrender to face Inti's justice after violating the sanctity of the Acllahuasi.
You has made your last mistake!

As I search the Acllahuasi for [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] I start having second thoughts about what I am doing. I am interfering with matters concerning the Yupaychaspa faith, and thus interfering with the will of Inti himself, and that might not be something I want to do.

After spending some time searching the Acllahuasi for [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] I finally manage to locate her deep inside the building. She is alone when I find her, which probably is for the best, and seems quite surprised to see me after all this time.
Come with me if you want to leave!

[aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is quite eager to leave, and aside from quickly gathering some useful supplies she does not waste time with her preparations. Mere minutes have passed when the declares that she is ready to leave the Acllahuasi and to return to [Root.Capital.GetName].

To your surprise, [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is not as eager to leave as I had expected. She tells me that I should not have come for her, and that she would rather remain in the Acllahuasi to do whatever is best for the Yupaychaspa faith and the Sapa Inca.
If that really is what you want...

[From.GetBestName] is not willing to leave me in the Acllahuasi, telling me that it is far too dangerous and that I will regret it one day. [From.GetSheHeCap] starts dragging me along, heading towards the nearest exit, and I need to decide if I want to do something about it.

[From.GetBestName] is not willing to leave me in the Acllahuasi, telling me that it is far too dangerous and that I will regret it one day. Knowing that this is neither what Inti nor what the Sapa Inca would want, I see only one thing to do at this point.

[From.GetBestName] is most unwilling to come with me from the Acllahuasi, even going as far as to call for the guards to come and stop me from taking her. As I have dealt with them previously, none appear, and she seems quite suprised by this development.
If you won't leave, you will die!

[From.GetBestName] is most unwilling to come with ne from the Acllahuasi, even going as far as to call for the guards to come and stop me from taking her. They arrive quite swiftly, weapons at the ready, and demand that I surrender to face Inti's justice after violating the sanctity of the Acllahuasi.
I will take you all on!

The guards arrive ready to fight, but they were not prepared to face a [Root.GetManWoman] as skilled as me, and I cut them down easily enough. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is still unwilling to come with me after the fighting is over, claiming that Inti's most loyal followers surely will strike me down.
If you won't leave, you will die!

The guards arrive ready to fight, but though they are able to wound me in the fighting they ultimately prove unable to stop me, and I cut them all down. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is still unwilling to come with me after the fighting is over, claiming that Inti's most loyal followers surely will strike me down.
If you won't leave, you will die!

The guards arrive ready to fight, and I take a grievous wound in the fighting, but in the end I prevail and manage cut them all down. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is still unwilling to come with me after the fighting is over, claiming that Inti's most loyal followers surely will strike me down.
If you won't leave, you will die!

The guards arrive ready to fight, and though I fight hard there are many of them. Eventually one of them manages to disarm me, and the others quickly pile on. They soon have me tied up, ready to be transported to a cell beneath the Acllahuasi.

The guards are ready to fight, and I take several wounds almost as soon as the fight begins. Though I do my best to fight on, the wounds keep adding up, and several of them are quite bad. It is not long before I am lying on the ground, my vision darkening.

I, [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName], and [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] all make our way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where we might find a ship to take us to [Root.Capital.GetName]. Both of the women seem quite eager to get there.

I, [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName], and [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] all make our way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where we might find a ship to take us to [Root.Capital.GetName]. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is still quite unhappy.

I and [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] both make our way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where we might find a ship to take us to [Root.Capital.GetName]. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] seems quite eager to get there.

I and [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] both make our way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where we might find a ship to take us to [Root.Capital.GetName]. [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] is still quite unhappy.

I and [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] both make our way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where we might find a ship to take us to [Root.Capital.GetName]. [aclla_rescue_attempt_lover.GetBestName] seems quite eager to get there.

I make my way out of the Acllahuasi without trouble and hurry through Cuzco, planning to head towards the nearest port where I might find a ship to take ne to [Root.Capital.GetName]. Though I failed to bring [aclla_to_rescue.GetBestName] with me, at least I avoided capture.
At long last I have returned to [Root.Capital.GetName] from my journey to Cuzco. Without doubt, work has piled up in my absence, so I will likely find plenty of things requiring my attention.

At long last I have arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Having been in the the Acllahuasi for quite some time, I am somewhat unaccustomed to what it is like to be elsewhere, but I suppose I will get used to it soon enough.

It has been some time since [From.GetBestName] rescued me from the Acllahuasi, and our romantic relationship is still ongoing. Lately, I have been considering the future, as it is quite possible that [From.GetBestName] and I could have a more formal relationship.
Surely he wants to marry me!
Surely he wants me as a concubine!
Surely this is enough for both of us!

[From.GetBestName], the former Aclla that I rescued from the Acllahuasi and that I have been taking to my bed ever since approached me today, suggesting that perhaps it would be right and proper for the two of us to get married.

[From.GetBestName], the former Aclla that I rescued from the Acllahuasi and that I have been taking to my bed ever since approached me today, suggesting that perhaps it would be right and proper for me to take her as an official concubine.
This woman is the highest possible class of SRI.10 She is destined to be sacrificed to the gods.
This woman belongs to the second-highest class of Aclla, and she can only wed the Sapa Inca.
This woman is part of the third class of the Aclla, and has been offered as a wife to one of the Sapa Inca's vassals.
This woman turned out not to be a very impressive Aclla, and she has been made a servant to one of the Sapa Inca's vassals.

A messenger arrived from the Acllahuasi today, carrying a missive informing me that [From.GetBestName] has been deemed a Yurac Aclla, which means that she is destinied to be sacrificed to the gods at a time when this would be beneficial for the Yupaychaspa faith.
I will look for opportunities to retrieve [From.GetBestName].
MY Willaq Umu presents before me a new girl who has just been selected from the Acllahuasi as a Huayru Aclla, [From.GetBestName]. The priests have ordained that she is to wed the Sapa Inca.
One of my vassals can have her...

My [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetFirstName], who was taken for the Acllahuasi years ago, has grown up to be a prime example of beauty, talent and decorum, and she has been wedded to [FromFrom.Spouse.GetBestName] himself!
We are all very proud of her!
The Acllahuasi of Cuzco has sent to me a Yurac Aclla. [From.GetFirstName] is one of the finest women to graduate from the sacred convent, and I have been blessed by the Sapa Inca to marry her!
Sacred or not, she is not my type...

My [GetFromFromRelation] [FromFrom.GetFirstName], who was taken for the Acllahuasi years ago, has grown up to be a fine example of beauty, talent and decorum. She has been wedded to [FromFrom.Spouse.GetBestName]!
She will have a good life there.

Not all who leave the Aclla do so as perfect examples of femininity. [From.GetBestName] has been deemed flawed in one way or another, but she still has skill, and the Willaq Umu designated her to me as a loyal servant.
I'm sure I'll be able to make use of her.

I was lost in thoughts during the latest feast, and not pleasant ones either. But [aclla_servant.GetFirstName] caught my attention, and demonstrated a dance from the Apurimac valley. It was wild, yet elegant, and her bracelets loudly rattled with each vigorous movement. The entrancing dance made me forget all about my worries...

One evening, strolling by the courtyard, I come across [aclla_servant.GetFirstName], singing songs about the glory of Inti. Her voice could go high as a songbird and low as a llama, as loud as the sunrise and as soft as a whisper. It made the hairs in my neck rise.

I sit in my room, gnashing my teeth with worries over the problems in my realm. Suddenly I hear a knock on the door, and [aclla_servant.GetFirstName] comes in carrying a small bowl. "Have some Chica, my [Root.GetLordLady]" she says with a rascally grin. "Beer doesn't judge, beer only listens."

The past months I have not been getting much sleep as I have been distressed over the state of my realm. However, [aclla_servant.GetFirstName]'s treats are doing their best to relieve that. She bakes the best sancu bread, and frankly, gorging on her delicacies has put my mind at rest more than I'd be willing to admit.
That was most definitely an excellent meal!

An emissary from the Imperial Palace arrived today, bringing the heavenly news that my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], was recognised in the Acllahuasi for her finesse, talent and charm. She is going to receive the highest possible honors: that of Quapaq Hucha - to be sacrificed to Inti!
Not my [GetFromRelation]... I must stop this!
I will look for opportunities to retrieve [From.GetBestName].
This young woman is being indoctrinated and sedated in preparation for her imminent sacrfice.

I have been informed that another sacrifice to Inti was recently carried out in the mountains near Cuzco. [From.GetBestName] was a shining example of beauty and virtue, and the best possible Qhapaq Hucha to present as a servant for the gods!
Blessings upon her, and her ayllu!

I have received the news that after a year of preparation, [FromFrom.GetBestName] was carried to the top of the Hamp'atu mountain, and there buried alive in the rocks while a priest spoke holy words to appease the mountain gods with the sacrifice. The Sapa Ica has bestowed great honors on my family for producing such a fine young woman.
We are very proud of her too...

[qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName] today, accompanied by a large number of guards and priests and priestesses sworn to Inti. She is due to be sacrificed on a nearby mountain within the next few days, for the glory of the Yupaychaspa faith.

[qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] is led out of [Root.Capital.GetName] accompanied by the guards and priestesses that arrived along with her from Cuzco. She does not speak to anyone as she walks, perhaps because she is resigned to her faith, or perhaps due to the drugs they have been feeding her, and she does not seem to know you are watching.
I guess I will never see her again...

[qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] is led out of [Root.Capital.GetName] accompanied by the guards and priestesses that arrived along with her from Cuzco. I have prepared for this moment ever since she arrived, and on my signal your soldiers create a diversion, allowing me to get close to her.
Come with me if you want to live!

I and [qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] sneak away as my soldiers keep the guards from Cuzco occupied. I signal my soldiers to wipe out the party from Cuzco, and they comply without hesitation, making it look like a bandit attack. As the battle is dying down, I move to comfort [qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName].

I and [qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] sneak away as my soldiers keep the guards from Cuzco occupied. Though my soldiers do their best to make it appear as if it was a bandit attack, I later learn that [meddlesome_vassal.GetBestName] saw what happened and has seen fit to inform the Sapa Inca of what I did.

[qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] proves to be unwilling to come with me, and she is quite outraged that I have dared to attack the party with her. She firmly declares that she will do as Inti desires, and that I had better leave at once.

The party from Cuzco that was travelling with [qhapaq_hucha.GetBestName] has returned to [Root.Capital.GetName] and inform me that the sacrifice was carried out as planned. They tell me that I must not be sad, as what was done was done for the glory of Inti.
In secret, Yupaychaspa faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
In secret, Reformed Yupaychaspa faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.
column3: Le grand prêtre dirige l'effort mondial visant à réunir davantage de personnes dans les rangs de sa société.
column4: Der Hohepriester des $SOCIETY|Y$-Zirkels, der die internationalen Bemühungen leitet, mehr Menschen in den Schoß der Familie zu führen.
column6: El Sumo sacerdote, que dirige la misión a escala internacional para atraer a más fieles.

column2: The High Priest, leading the international effort of bringing more people into the fold.

column2: This character practices Yupaychaspa Paganism in secret.
This character practices Yupaychaspa Paganism in secret.
The secret followers of the Yupaychaspa faith have little need for foreign faiths. One day, they will be strong enough to step out of the shadows once more.
The secret followers of the Yupaychaspa faith have little need for foreign faiths. One day, they will be strong enough to step out of the shadows once more.

column3: A sacred carved stone pillar bearing deep religious significance for the local pagan tribes.

column2: The §YYupaychaspa§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
The §YYupaychaspa§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...

By constructing this Great Pillar, the fires of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have been stoked, bringing a bit of life to the spirits of our old and fierce gods. The first offerings are already being presented at the feet of the new sacred monument of [From.GetName].
Expelled the Children of the Light
The fearless warriors of the Kamayuk order are trained here. They represent the elite of the Inca war machine and entire armies have been known to rout at the sight them.
The fearless warriors of the Kamayuk order are trained here. They represent the elite of the Inca war machine and entire armies have been known to rout at the sight them.

The reformed Inca religion has a proper Holy Book, a standardized liturgy and a formed church hierarchy led by a dedicated High Priest who can be vassalized by secular rulers. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded\n§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars

The Inca religion features a creation myth centered the legendary founder of the Inca Dynasty, Manco Cápac. Revered as a god of fire and sun, the mythology features his coming to power as its legend. The Incas permitted different cultures to keep their individual religions, which resulted in overlapping of the various gods. Some of the gods are Inti, god of sun, Viracocha, god of everything, Yakumama, mother of water and Apu Illapu, god of thunder and lightning. Defining features in game:
§Y*§! Low-tech non-pagans have very low Supply Limit in Pagan counties
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
§Y*§! The Inca faith can be reformed
